thread.title: Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics
thread.title_full: Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics

author: BRIAN MAHONEY AP Basketball Writer
title: Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics
text:
Adam Hunger Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics 
New York Knicks forward Kyle O'Quinn (9) drives to the basket defended by Boston Celtics center Tyler Zeller during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Adam Hunger) Adam Hunger Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics 
New York Knicks forward Kyle O'Quinn (9) dives for the ball in front of Boston Celtics guard Isaiah Thomas and forward Amir Johnson, right, during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Adam Hunger) Adam Hunger Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics 
Boston Celtics forward Amir Johnson (90) blocks a shot by New York Knicks center Robin Lopez during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Adam Hunger) Adam Hunger Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics 
New York Knicks forward Kyle O'Quinn (9) battles with Boston Celtics guard Isaiah Thomas (4) for a loose ball during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game at Madison Square Garden on Friday, October 16, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Adam Hunger) Posted: Saturday, October 17, 2015 1:00 am Williams leads unbeaten Knicks past Celtics BY BRIAN MAHONEY AP Basketball Writer Eagle-Tribune 
NEW YORK (AP) — Derrick Williams scored 19 points in another strong performance and the New York Knicks beat the Boston Celtics 101-95 on Friday night to remain unbeaten in the preseason. 
The No. 2 overall pick of the 2011 draft who struggled in Minnesota and Sacramento just missed his third straight 20-point game and made a 3-pointer with 2:11 left after the Celtics had closed within two points. 
Isaiah Thomas scored 13 in Boston’s first preseason loss. 
CELTICS: Jared Sullinger grabbed 10 rebounds but shot 1 of 8. 
KNICKS: Kyle O’Quinn finished with 13 points and 11 rebounds. 
INJURY UPDATES: Arron Afflalo started in his first action of the preseason for the Knicks after recovering from a sore left hamstring and scored eight points. ... Rookie Kristaps Porzingis sat out a second straight game with a strained left quadriceps but is expected to start Saturday at Charlotte. 
WELCOME BACK: David Lee, who played for the Knicks from 2005-10, got a nice cheer when he was announced with Boston’s starting lineup. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
